answer: Administers and communicates the College's benefits program including, but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life, long-term disability, accidental death and dismemberment, flexible spending accounts, retirement options, and educational benefits partnering with New Mexico Public School Insurance Authority, other vendors, and College stakeholders. Responsible for compliance with the Affordable Care Act and all government legislation related to benefits and wellness. Influences, shapes, and collaborates on employee benefit programs and wellness initiatives. Provides training to departments on new, existing, or amended employee wellness and benefit programs. Offers educational sessions and fairs regarding health, wellness, retirement, benefits, and the Employee Assistance Program.
